abstracts.cdata!:
The rural road gravel assessment program
            (RRGAP) comprised the evaluation of a representative
            selection of 269 World Bank (WB)-funded road links from 16
            provinces. Between 2003 and 2012 three phases of trial road
            selection, design, and construction were undertaken under
            the RRST program. The objective was to compare new pavement
            options in terms of construction and in-service performance
            against a number of standard Vietnamese control sections,
            monitoring of the trial sections commenced as soon as
            construction was completed. A total of 156 kilo meter (km)
            of trial roads have been constructed within a range of road
            environments in 16 provinces, from which a representative
            123 sections of between 80m to 200m in length have been
            selected for ongoing performance monitoring. The condition
            monitoring of the Vietnamese trials has resulted in the
            assembly of a significant amounts of data on the performance
            of a wide variety of pavement and surfacing types.
